ul.li1: 1For look, the Lord Yahweh of hosts is removing every source of supportLiterally “supplies and supplies”
ul.li2: from Jerusalem and from Judah:
ul.li1: all of the supplies of bread
ul.li2: and all of the supplies of water,
ul.li1: 2mighty warrior and man of war,
ul.li2: judge and prophet,
and diviner and elder,
ul.li1: 3captain of fifty and the honorable men of rank,
ul.li2: and counselor and skillful magicians and skillful enchanter.
ul.li1: 4And I will make boys their princes,
ul.li2: and children shall rule over them.
ul.li1: 5And the people will be oppressed by each otherLiterally “man by man”
ul.li2: and a man by his neighbor.
ul.li1: The boy will act arrogantly toward the elder,
ul.li2: and the dishonorable toward the honorable.
ul.li1: 6Indeed, a man will seize his brother
ul.li2: in the house of his father:
ul.li1: “You have a cloak;Literally “a cloak for you”
ul.li2: you shall be a leader for us,
and this heap of ruins shall be under your hand!”
ul.li1: 7He will lift up his voice on that day, saying,
“I will not be a healer;
ul.li2: in my house there is no bread
You shall not make me the leader of the people!”
ul.li1: 8For Jerusalem has stumbled,
ul.li2: and Judah has fallen
ul.li1: because their speech and their deeds are against Yahweh,
ul.li2: defying the eyes of his glory.
ul.li1: 9The look on their faces testifies against them
ul.li2: and they declare their sin like Sodom;
ul.li1: Woe to their soul!
ul.li2: For they have dealt out evil to themselves.
ul.li1: 10Tell the innocentSingular that it is good
ul.li2: for they shall eat the fruit of their deeds.
ul.li1: 11Woe to the wicked!Singular It is bad!
ul.li2: For what is done by his hands will be done to him.
ul.li1: 12My people—children are their oppressors,
ul.li2: and women rule over them.
ul.li1: My people, your leaders are misleading you,
ul.li2: and they confuse the course of your paths.
ul.li1: 13Yahweh takes his stand to conduct a legal case
ul.li2: and takes his stand to judge the peoples.
ul.li1: 14Yahweh enters into judgment with the elders of his people and its princes.
“And you! You have devoured the vineyard;
ul.li2: the spoil of the poor is in your houses!
ul.li1: 15WhyLiterally “What to you” do you crush my people
ul.li2: and grind the face of the poor?”

chapter.p: declaresLiterally “declaration of” the Lord Yahweh of hosts.

ul.li1: 16And Yahweh said: “BecauseThere are two Hebrew words for “because” here the daughters of Zion are haughty,
ul.li2: and they walk with outstretched neck,
and they give flirting glances with their eyes,
ul.li3: mincing along as they go,Literally “they go walking and mincing along”
ul.li2: and with their feet they rattle their bangles,Literally “they tinkle with their feet”
ul.li1: 17the Lord will make the headsHebrew “head” of the daughters of Zion scabby,
ul.li2: and Yahweh will lay their foreheads bare.”
ul.li1: 18In that day the Lord will take away the finery of the anklets
ul.li2: and the headbands and the crescent necklaces,
ul.li1: 19the pendants and the bracelets and the veils,
ul.li2: 20the headdresses and the armlets and the sashes,
ul.li1: and the perfume boxesLiterally “houses of the breath” and the amulets,
ul.li2: 21the signet rings and the nose rings,
ul.li1: 22the festal robes and the mantles,
ul.li2: and the cloaks and the handbags,
ul.li1: 23and the mirrors and the linen garments,
ul.li2: and the turbans and the wraps.
ul.li1: 24And this shall happen: There will be
ul.li2: a stench instead of perfume,
ul.li1: and a rope instead of a sash,
ul.li2: and baldness instead of a well-set hairdo,
ul.li1: and a clothing wrap of sackcloth instead of a rich robe,
ul.li2: branding instead of beauty.
ul.li1: 25Your men shall fall by the sword,
ul.li2: and your warriors in battle.
ul.li1: 26And herThat is, Jerusalem’s gates shall lament and mourn,
ul.li2: and she shall be banished;
ul.li3: she shall sit upon the ground.
